body.name: Thermalright Integrated Fan Hub, 10-Port 4 Pin PC Fan Controller, 12V Fan Hub, Support up to 10 Fans, SATA Power Cord Direct Input
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Sunday, February 18 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 12 hrs 16 mins
FREE pickup Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest pickup Wednesday, February 14. Order within 18 hrs 16 mins
features: Thermalright is a Taiwanese brand with more than 20 years of development. It has a certain popularity in domestic and foreign markets and has a decisive influence in the player market. R & D product lines include: CPU air-cooled radiator, chassis cooling fan, thermal conductive silicone pad, thermal conductive silicone grease, CPU fan controller, anti falling off mounting bracket, support mounting bracket and other commodities.
Built in strong double-sided sticker, fixed on the chassis with double-sided sticker. SATA power line direct transmission, more concise and more efficient. Maintain stable output under high load.
Small body, large capacity. Multi line control to keep cables in order.
This fan hub supports the installation of 10 groups of fans, making it easy to manage wiring. Strong paste installation mode, convenient SATA power line direct transmission, and safety is guaranteed.
Support fan speed reading and PWM Fan regulation. (due to the limitation of PWM mainboard IC reading principle, only the speed of a single fan inserted into the red interface is recognized).

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: POWERED BY SATA CABLE With SATA power input, the HUB maintains stable current output under heavy load. SAVES SPACE, SAVES CABLE MANAGEMENT 10 Channel fan PWM signal sync, helping neater cable management in computer build. STICKS ANYWHERE Comparing with magnets, double-sided adhesive provides more stability inside computer cases, besides, less magnetic field means less interference with electrical components.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to install. Its a Fan hub with PWM Support
reviews.reviewText: Its a hub that connects one side to the MB PWM header for fan speed. I used this to control a 3080 in which the fan headers died. I got adapters to convert it to PVM MB connectors and set my rpm speed as well as fan curves for temperature in FanControl from Github. Works great and controls the fans as I need them too

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Does what it’s supposed to do
reviews.reviewText: Not gonna lie, after reading some of the earlier reviews (especially the one about the persons hub starting to smoke), I was quite hesitant to purchase this, but since my case fans and CPU cooler are both made by Thermalright (great products as well so far btw) I figured it was appropriate to also get a Thermalright fan/rgb hub for my new PC build. The materials don’t feel super high quality, but for the price that was pretty much expected. Overall, the device works as intended and I haven’t had any issues with it so far. I’m satisfied with my purchase. Will update if that changes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works great, a little thick..
reviews.reviewText: First, you should know this thing works fine. Takes 1 SATA power cable and includes an RGB cable to go from RGB header to device. Strangely the input port is not marked but, 12v goes on the left just like all the other ports.What I discovered *after* I bought this was I don't need it. It never occurred to me to look up how many amps my fans use on rgb, and that the average RGB head is doing 3 amps.My fans (7 of arctic p14 RGB) only use 0.2A each on RGB. So I could fairly easily fit 10+ fans off that one header (7 * 0.2 = 1.4A.. so even 14 fans would be 2.8A). Arctics website shows the power draw for both fan and RGB. I'm not sure about other manufacturers but I'd assume they'll have it listed too.Lastly, it's just a little thick, too thick to put between my side panel and backplate. So I had to stuff it inside a hard drive cage and meh. It just bugs me.I'll probably just get an RGB splitter cable to make cable management a little easier and remove this device. But it does work great if you need something like this!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Poor quality, look elsewhere
reviews.reviewText: Installation was straightforward but the quality is lacking. Mine failed 2 months after installation. You get what you pay for.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Simple and cheap
reviews.reviewText: I like the product so far, I do not think it supports ARGB but I know some other models do!Work great with Thermalright's case fans and I am able to control all fans from this hub!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The fan controller controls my fans well and works with color

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Works great. Got a coolermaster liquid cooler that came with another hub which was broken. After hours I plugged this one in and it worked right away.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Buena opcion aunque es un poco grande, requiere buen espacio en el lateral de la torre
